bio:treatment.discussion: Potamogeton obtusifolius is a distinctive linear-leaved species with the leaf blades round at the apex, especially when fruiting inflorescences 5--7 mm wide are present. This is unusually wide for one of the linear-leaved species.
Two hybrids, Potamogeton obtusifolius ´ P. pusillus (= P. ´ saxonicus Hagström) and P. friesii ´ obtusifolius (= P. ´ semifructus A. Bennett ex Ascherson & Graebner), have been described.
